description: Comprehensive ROI calculation methodology for PermaFrost NMR treatment - both preventive and restorative approaches
data_source: Corpus of 82 PE-certified field measurements with equipment age documentation

restorative.name: Restorative ROI
restorative.description: Calculates value of RESTORING efficiency already lost to thermal degradation
restorative.applicable_when: Equipment has accumulated thermal degradation (typically 5+ years old)
restorative.calculation_basis: Restored efficiency percentage applied to remaining equipment life

example.scenario: 200-ton chiller, 10 years old, 25% degradation, 13 years remaining life

preventive.name: Preventive ROI
preventive.description: Calculates value of PREVENTING all future thermal degradation over equipment lifetime
preventive.applicable_when: New equipment (0-3 years) or immediately after major service/overhaul
preventive.calculation_basis: Sum of avoided degradation cost for each year over full equipment lifetime
preventive.key_insight: Highest total ROI because preventing full lifetime of degradation - savings compound yearly

formula.lifetime_avoided_waste: sum of yearly_avoided_waste for all years of equipment life

comparison_table.conclusion: Preventive treatment yields ~2x higher lifetime ROI despite lower immediate improvement

corpus_vs_ashrae.summary: Corpus field measurements (82 PE-certified studies) complement and validate ASHRAE research
corpus_vs_ashrae.recommendation: Use corpus model as primary calculation basis, cite ASHRAE research for context

corpus_model.name: Corpus Degradation Model
corpus_model.basis: 82 PE-certified before/after field measurements where equipment age was documented
corpus_model.methodology: Polynomial curve fitted to real degradation data by equipment age buckets
advantages: Real equipment under real operating conditions
Controlled comparison - same equipment pre/post treatment
Measures thermal degradation specifically - what PermaFrost NMR addresses
133 total case studies across multiple equipment types, ages, industries
corpus_model.plateau_explanation: Degradation plateaus after 15 years as severely degraded equipment is typically replaced rather than measured

ashrae_model.name: ASHRAE Research Model
ashrae_model.basis: Industry standard ~2% COP decline per year from published ASHRAE research
ashrae_model.source: UCF/FSEC study, ASHRAE 1998 Handbook Chapter 2.9, ASHRAE RP-751/RP-601
ashrae_model.methodology: Linear degradation: 2% per year with 30% maximum cap
context: Conservative baseline from published ASHRAE Handbook methodology
Corpus field data shows real-world degradation often exceeds this baseline
Provides industry-standard reference point for comparison
Based on peer-reviewed ASHRAE research including RP-751 and RP-601

key_differences.early_years: Corpus shows ~16% degradation at Year 1 vs ASHRAE's 2% - suggests rapid initial fouling
key_differences.mid_life: Corpus shows higher degradation 5-15 years (25-26% vs ASHRAE 10-30%)
key_differences.late_life: Both plateau around 30% maximum, but corpus reaches plateau earlier
key_differences.explanation: Corpus includes initial oil distribution losses; ASHRAE may only measure ongoing decline

ui_requirements.always_show_both: Per user requirement: Always show BOTH preventive and restorative ROI side-by-side
ui_requirements.no_auto_selection: Do NOT automatically select one mode based on equipment age
ui_requirements.corpus_as_primary: Highlight corpus model as primary calculation, show ASHRAE for comparison
display_elements: Yearly breakdown chart showing compounding savings

training_qa_examples.question: What's the ROI on treating a brand new chiller?
training_qa_examples.answer: While immediate efficiency improvement will be modest (5-15%), the PREVENTIVE ROI is the highest of any treatment scenario. Treating on Day 1 prevents 23 years of thermal degradation, yielding 600-800% lifetime ROI. This is nearly double the ROI of waiting until Year 10 to treat the same chiller.
training_qa_examples.key_concept: Evaluate new equipment treatment by PREVENTIVE value, not immediate improvement

training_qa_examples.question: Why would I treat new equipment if it only shows 10% improvement?
training_qa_examples.answer: The 10% improvement represents the existing baseline degradation (even new equipment has some oil distribution losses). But the real value is PREVENTIVE - you're locking in near-design efficiency for the equipment's entire 23-year life. Without treatment, that same chiller will lose 25-30% efficiency over time. The $25,000 treatment cost saves over $200,000 in prevented energy waste.

training_qa_examples.question: Should I wait until my equipment shows problems before treating?
training_qa_examples.answer: No - waiting reduces your total ROI by nearly half. Treating a 10-year-old chiller with 25% degradation yields ~377% ROI. Treating that same chiller on Day 1 would have yielded ~739% ROI. Every year you wait, you're paying for efficiency loss that could have been prevented.

training_qa_examples.question: How does corpus data compare to ASHRAE standards?
training_qa_examples.answer: The corpus model is based on 82 PE-certified field measurements on real equipment under real operating conditions. ASHRAE's ~2%/year estimate is a conservative baseline from published research. Corpus field data shows real-world degradation often exceeds ASHRAE estimates, particularly in early equipment life. We recommend using the corpus model as primary and showing ASHRAE for comparison.
